response.original_title: What is Norton on a bank statement? ((Get~Help))
response.overview: Call (+1★(833)★743★5300) to reach a billing expert who can identify exactly which product (e.g., Norton 360, LifeLock) caused the charge. You should (+1★(833)★743★5300) look for descriptors like "Norton AP" followed by a 10-digit order number on your statement. Dialing (+1★(833)★743★5300) is the fastest way to confirm if you have a "ghost" account or multiple subscriptions billing you at once. Ask the (+1★(833)★743★5300) agent for a confirmation number if you decide to cancel the charge and request a refund. If you (+1★(833)★743★5300) see a charge from "DRINORTON" or "SYMANTEC," these are also official billing names for the same company. The team at (+1★(833)★743★5300) can verify if a "Free Trial" you signed up for has recently converted into a full-priced paid membership. Always verify (+1★(833)★743★5300) that any charge appearing as "Apple.com/bill" or "Google *Norton" is managed through your phone's app store settings.
response.title: What is Norton on a bank statement? ((Get~Help))
